fields.doc: The name of the AD/LDAP group.
fields.name: groupName

fields.doc: The name of the AD/LDAP user.
fields.name: username
name
fields.doc: group name e.g. wherehows-dev, ask_metadata

fields.name: info

type.name: CorpGroupInfo
type.doc: group of corpUser, it may contains nested group

fields.name: email
fields.doc: email of this group

fields.name: admins
fields.doc: owners of this group

fields.name: members
fields.doc: List of ldap urn in this group.

fields.name: groups
fields.doc: List of groups in this group.
Information of the corp group

models.name: CorpGroupAspect
models.doc: A union of all supported metadata aspects for a CorpGroup

fields.name: name
fields.doc: The name of the aggregation, e.g, platform, origin

fields.name: aggregations
fields.doc: List of aggregations showing the number of documents falling into each bucket. e.g, for platform aggregation, the bucket can be hive, kafka, etc

models.name: AutoCompleteResult
models.doc: The model for the auto complete result

fields.name: query
fields.doc: The original chars typed by user

fields.name: suggestions
fields.doc: A list of typeahead suggestions

models.name: Condition
models.doc: The matching condition in a filter criterion

symbolDocs.CONTAIN: Represent the relation: String field contains value, e.g. name contains Profile
symbolDocs.END_WITH: Represent the relation: String field ends with value, e.g. name ends with Event
symbolDocs.EQUAL: Represent the relation: field = value, e.g. platform = hdfs
symbolDocs.GREATER_THAN: Represent the relation greater than, e.g. ownerCount > 5
symbolDocs.GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO: Represent the relation greater than or equal to, e.g. ownerCount >= 5
symbolDocs.LESS_THAN: Represent the relation less than, e.g. ownerCount < 3
symbolDocs.LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO: Represent the relation less than or equal to, e.g. ownerCount <= 3
symbolDocs.START_WITH: Represent the relation: String field starts with value, e.g. name starts with PageView

models.name: Criterion
models.doc: A criterion for matching a field with given value

fields.name: field
fields.doc: The name of the field that the criterion refers to

fields.name: value
fields.doc: The value of the intended field

fields.name: condition
fields.doc: The condition for the criterion, e.g. EQUAL, START_WITH

models.name: Filter
models.doc: The filter for finding an record or a collection of records

fields.name: criteria
fields.doc: A list of criteria the filter applies to the query

models.name: SearchResultMetadata
models.doc: The model for the search result

fields.name: searchResultMetadatas
fields.doc: A list of search result metadata such as aggregations

fields.name: urns
fields.doc: A list of urns corresponding to search documents (in order) as returned by the search index

models.name: SortCriterion
models.doc: Sort order along with the field to sort it on, to be applied to the results.

fields.name: field
fields.doc: The name of the field that sorting has to be applied to

fields.name: order

type.name: SortOrder
type.doc: The order used to sort the results

symbolDocs.ASCENDING: If results need to be sorted in ascending order
symbolDocs.DESCENDING: If results need to be sorted in descending order

fields.doc: The order to sort the results i.e. ASCENDING or DESCENDING

models.name: BackfillResult
models.doc: The model for the result of a backfill

fields.name: entities
urn
fields.doc: Urn of the backfilled entity

fields.name: aspects
fields.doc: List of the aspects backfilled for the entity
List of backfilled entities

models.name: CorpGroupSnapshot
models.doc: A metadata snapshot for a specific CorpGroup entity.

fields.name: urn
fields.doc: URN for the entity the metadata snapshot is associated with.

fields.name: aspects
fields.doc: The list of metadata aspects associated with the LdapUser. Depending on the use case, this can either be all, or a selection, of supported aspects.

models.name: EmptyRecord
models.doc: An literally empty record.  Intended as a marker to indicate the absence of content where a record type is required.  If used the underlying DataMap *must* be empty, EmptyRecordValidator is provided to help enforce this.  For example,  CreateRequest extends Request<EmptyRecord> to indicate it has no response body.   Also, a ComplexKeyResource implementation that has no ParamKey should have a signature like XyzResource implements ComplexKeyResource<XyzKey, EmptyRecord, Xyz>.
